com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.functions

Class Function<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.functions.Function<I,O>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the function's input type
    O - the target property's value type. Make sure it matches.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CameraFunction, CompositeFunction, SourceFunction

    public class Function<I,O>
extends Object
    Functions are used to change properties in relation to the state of the map.

    The value for any layout or paint property may be specified as a function. Functions allow you to make the appearance of a map feature change with the current zoom level and/or the feature's properties.

    See Also:
    The style specification

    • Method Detail

      • zoom

        public static <Z extends Number,O> CameraFunction<Z,O> zoom(@NonNull
                                                            ExponentialStops<Z,O> stops)
        Create an exponential CameraFunction

        Zoom functions allow the appearance of a map feature to change with map’s zoom. Zoom functions can be used to create the illusion of depth and control data density. Each stop is an array with two elements, the first is a zoom and the second is a function output value.

        Type Parameters:
        Z - the zoom level type (Float, Integer)
        O - the property type
        Parameters:
        stops - the stops implementation that define the function. @see Stops.exponential(Stop[])
        Returns:
        the CameraFunction
        See Also:
        CameraFunction, ExponentialStops, Stops.exponential(Stop[]), Stops.exponential(Stop[]), Stop.stop(I, com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.layers.PropertyValue<O>)

      • zoom

        public static <Z extends Number,O> CameraFunction<Z,O> zoom(@NonNull
                                                            IntervalStops<Z,O> stops)
        Create an interval CameraFunction

        Zoom functions allow the appearance of a map feature to change with map’s zoom. Zoom functions can be used to create the illusion of depth and control data density. Each stop is an array with two elements, the first is a zoom and the second is a function output value.

        Type Parameters:
        Z - the zoom level type (Float, Integer)
        O - the property type
        Parameters:
        stops - the stops implementation that define the function. @see Stops.interval(Stop[])
        Returns:
        the CameraFunction
        See Also:
        CameraFunction, IntervalStops, Stops.interval(Stop[]), Stop.stop(I, com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.layers.PropertyValue<O>)

      • property

        public static <I,O> SourceFunction<I,O> property(@NonNull
                                                 String property,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 ExponentialStops<I,O> stops)
        Create an exponential SourceFunction

        Source functions allow the appearance of a map feature to change with its properties. Source functions can be used to visually differentiate types of features within the same layer or create data visualizations. Each stop is an array with two elements, the first is a property input value and the second is a function output value. Note that support for property functions is not available across all properties and platforms at this time.

        Type Parameters:
        I - the function input type
        O - the function output type
        Parameters:
        property - the feature property name
        stops - the stops
        Returns:
        the SourceFunction
        See Also:
        SourceFunction, ExponentialStops, Stops.exponential(Stop[]), Stop.stop(I, com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.layers.PropertyValue<O>)

        public static <T> SourceFunction<T,T> property(@NonNull
                                               String property,
                                               @NonNull
                                               IdentityStops<T> stops)
        Create an identity SourceFunction

        Source functions allow the appearance of a map feature to change with its properties. Source functions can be used to visually differentiate types of features within the same layer or create data visualizations. Each stop is an array with two elements, the first is a property input value and the second is a function output value. Note that support for property functions is not available across all properties and platforms at this time.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function input/output type
        Parameters:
        property - the feature property name
        stops - the stops
        Returns:
        the SourceFunction
        See Also:
        SourceFunction, IdentityStops, Stops.identity(), Stop.stop(I, com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.layers.PropertyValue<O>)

Each stop is an array with two elements, the first is a property input value and the second is a function output value.       • composite

        public static <Z extends Number,I,O> CompositeFunction<Z,I,O> composite(@NonNull
                                                                        String property,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        CategoricalStops<Stop.CompositeValue<Z,I>,O> stops)
        Create a composite, categorical function.

        Composite functions allow the appearance of a map feature to change with both its properties and zoom. Each stop is an array with two elements, the first is an object with a property input value and a zoom, and the second is a function output value. Note that support for property functions is not yet complete.

        Type Parameters:
        Z - the zoom function input type (Float usually)
        I - the function input type for the source part of the function
        O - the function output type
        Parameters:
        property - the feature property name for the source part of the function
        stops - the stops
        Returns:
        the CompositeFunction
        See Also:
        CompositeFunction, CategoricalStops, Stops.categorical(Stop[]), Stop.stop(I, com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.layers.PropertyValue<O>)

      • composite

        public static <Z extends Number,I,O> CompositeFunction<Z,I,O> composite(@NonNull
                                                                        String property,
                                                                        @NonNull
                                                                        ExponentialStops<Stop.CompositeValue<Z,I>,O> stops)
        Create a composite, exponential function.

        Composite functions allow the appearance of a map feature to change with both its properties and zoom. Each stop is an array with two elements, the first is an object with a property input value and a zoom, and the second is a function output value. Note that support for property functions is not yet complete.

        Type Parameters:
        Z - the zoom function input type (Float usually)
        I - the function input type for the source part of the function
        O - the function output type
        Parameters:
        property - the feature property name for the source part of the function
        stops - the stops
        Returns:
        the CompositeFunction
        See Also:
        CompositeFunction, ExponentialStops, Stops.exponential(Stop[]), Stop.stop(I, com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.style.layers.PropertyValue<O>)
